title.narrative: INTERFACE BASIC SOCIAL SERVICES AND SP

description.narrative: Populations are informed on the situation of children rights especially the most disadvantaged and basic social services, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Child victims of exclusion benefit from policies and programs based on evidence

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Child poverty public advocacy (media and social media, campaigns)
Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Social welfare workforce strengthening - Case management, referral, capacity development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Populations are informed on the situation of children rights especially the most disadvantaged and basic social services

description.narrative: Despite some delays caused by the pandemic, progress was achieved in many aspects. Thedissemination of the results of the 2018 child poverty analysis continued through meetings on the three islands. The setting up of a single social register progressed further with various stakeholders discussing the legislation and the roadmap for the effective roll-out of the register. Support to the socio-economic reintegration of young girls victims of violence entered its second year, while the relevant data was appropriately collected and processed on the three islands. | Status:Met | As-of Date:10/01/2022
